name: Marjorie's Kauai Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Kauai for our honeymoon and we'd never been in Kauai before Our stay was after 3 weeks in Hawaii visiting Oahu, Maui, Big Island and then Kauai.
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of these Islands are very different and we loved all the things we did and saw in these places.Arriving at the Marjorie Inn after 2 nights in an other sister's Inn in the area was a great pleasure and after spending many times in a bunch of resorts and Inn was by far the best place we stayed.
reviews.title: Best Part of Honeymoon

reviews.text: We've been welcomed by Alexi the Innkeeper whom leaded us to our room after a short explanation of the rules of the Inn we loved the first one ' do at least 3 things by day" Sure we did..lol
reviews.title: Majories is a top ten B & B in Kauai

likes.liked: — The accomodations and where they were located and the staff

reviews.text: Our room was big, large and very clean with all the amenities you need for a wonderful stay, we had a spacious lanai with chairs, table and lawn chairs overlooked the valley and the pool.
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been amazed by the beauty surrounded the Inn the peace and quietness.
reviews.title: Paradise

likes.liked: — The cleanliness, friendliness and comfortable accomodations
likes.disliked: — That our stay was too short

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent three nights in the Valley View room and have only praise for both the inn and inn keepers. We had the unusual pleasure of meeting both sets of hosts; Mike and Alexis checked us in and we received a bounty of great advice from them. Unfortunately, we only met Michael and Daniela the last morning of our stay, but they were engaging and a delight to talk with and surely would have provided us with outstanding advice for our stay had we met earlier.
reviews.title: An excellent choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn peeks from the trees on the sunset facing valley slope, and is a sublime hideaway. There is definitely a sense of idyllic seclusion from the property. The rooster calls across the lowlands, and bird songs (with the occasional gecko squawk) were really the only sounds we heard. We kept so busy enjoying the many gorgeous sites of Kauai; there was little chance to enjoy the Inn’s amenities. The pool looked perfect for morning laps, and the hot-tub an excellent place for dusk soaks. Our room was spacious and comfortable, and the Inn provides an eclectic selection of outdoor toys for your enjoyment; from bicycles to snorkel gear, lawn chairs and boogie boards.
reviews.title: We enjoyed everything about Marjorie's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was of the continental variety, with a few additional local items. I tend to eat larger breakfasts before active days, so I might recommend the Inn’s breakfast as a prelude to a larger meal, should you be planning hikes or a day of physical exertion. That is definitely not a critique of the breakfast selection; the selection would be more than enough to fuel an afternoon of site seeing.
reviews.title: Million Dollar View

likes.liked: — the lanai (deck) - it was huge and the views were amazing
likes.disliked: — room size - there wasn't much room to open and unpack our suitcases

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great choice in a truly beautiful place.
reviews.title: Lovely Place with Great People!

likes.liked: — The Innkeepers- great people make the difference!
likes.disliked: — Parking on a hill took a little getting used to (because I'm from a rather flat state!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at Marjorie's Kauai Inn exceded all of our expectations. The innkeepers, Daniela and Michael, were friendly and offered several suggestions for activities and dining. Our room was comfortable, unique and had a large private lanai that overlooked a beautiful valley. Books on local sights, snorkel gear and beach chairs were available to borrow. A simple, but delicious, breakfast was served daily. It was a good time to greet the other guests and compare notes. The inn was a great change of pace from a large resort and we would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me preface this by saying that we are young professionals that are pretty well-travelled. I did extensive research before booking Marjories's for the second half of our Hawaian honeymoon. We were staying at a luxury resort for the first half & made the choice to stay at a B&B for the second half. We often stay at both resorts and B&B's as we enjoy the unique experience that both offer.
reviews.title: Wanted to love it --- couldn't help but be dissapointed though!!!
Great place to stay!
reviews.text: We wanted to love Marjorie's, but couldn't help but be dissapointed for the following reasons:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. We arrived at 6 p.m to a note on the door from the inn-keeper telling us the rules & that we had a balance, etc. Nobody was there to greet us. It was very strange. Our room was left unlocked. It kind-of felt like the Bates motel. This obviously was NOT the B&B welcome that we were expecting, especially since our confirmation letter stated that somebody would be there to greet us as long as we gave them our approximate arrival time which we did.
reviews.title: 5-Star Service, Location, View, Hospitality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The breakfast each morning was dissapointing. Neither of us are big eaters, but a B&B is supposed to have a good breakfast even if it is continental fare. The extent of the offerings were: ONE choice of fruit and ONE choice of muffin plus toast each day. The muffin choice alternated between blueberry and cinnamon roll for our ENTIRE stay. One morning it was a little awkward when the interim inn-keepers friend (who was often there in the morning) was making french toast in the kitchen for herself as we got our standard watermelon & cinnamon roll. I almost requested some french toast for myself!!!
reviews.title: Relaxing in Our Little Slice of Heaven

reviews.text: 3. The first morning we were there we shared with the inn-keeper that our flight left late (11 p.m) on our last day there. She suggested that we do a snorkeling excursion with a company that she would book for us. We took her up on the offer. On the day BEFORE our last day there we asked what to do with our luggage while we went on the excursion and if we could shower when we returned home around noon from the excursion since our flight didn't leave unti 11 p.m. and we had a TEN hour flight back to NY. We were CURTLY told that we could store the luggage in the garage & shower by the pool outside. This was ridiculous to me. We cancelled the excursion.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Beautiful Home, Good Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I booked 6 nights at Marjorie's b/c we were looking for an affordable place to stay that gave us privacy, but was also close to the beach. In Kauai finding all of the above isn't necessarily easy, but we did it!
reviews.title: Relaxing in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mike was the gracious host to our fabulous vacation. His breakfast were tasty, even fresh squeezed OJ, and he provided great knowledge of the island.
reviews.title: Marjorie's is better than ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the pictures on the website and tripadvisor showed adequate accommodations, they cannot due Marjorie's justice. The place is more modern than the pictures convey, and more private then we ever expected. We enjoyed using the beaches in Popiu, which was only a 10 minute drive, as well as fabulous hikes around all of the island.
reviews.title: What a great find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is a true value. For $130 a night we received a great breakfast, a pool and hot tub to share with only 4 others (we never did need to share), access to beach chairs, coolers, snorkel gear, a movie collection, and much more! All rooms have any mini-kitchen, and we used the outdoor grill to make kabobs from the local grocery. This afforded us more time to relax and we saved money on dinners while enjoying them from our private lanai!
reviews.title: "Awesome" just doesn't describe it accurately enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had visited Marjories Kauai Inn, 8 years ago, when the original "Marjorie" owned the Inn. We promised ourselves that we would return to Kauai, and we booked 4 nights at Marjorie's Kauai Inn this past April 2009.
reviews.title: Everything we expected and more...

description: Marjorie's has a 50' salt water pool overlooking the beautiful Lawai valley. There are 2 hot tubs for our guests to use. We want all of our guests to feel at home so we provide boogie boards, fins and snorkel equipment, bikes, a kayak, a large bbq by the pool, and a surf board. Our guests can use the washer/dryer.
